favourite.article: Praise the Lord He is able to do SUPERABUNDANTLY above all that we ask or think! Take a moment to contemplate the word "superabundantly". When we fail or feel weak, simply stand by the Word that He will supply you superabundantly.
Oh Lord, thank You that You are ALWAYS able even when we're not. Glory to God! Forever and EVER! PTL!
To Him be the glory forever and ever, Amen! I pray read Eph. 3:16-19 every day, and ever since I heard of this hymn, I've added 20 and 21 to the list. Hallelujah, the Lord shall get the glory!
Wow! Amen! Praise the Lord!!! Truly that He is able to do super abundantly more than what we ask or think... Glory to You Lord Jesus.....!
We enjoyed this song at the SST! Oh! He is able to do superabunduntly above all that we ask or think! Praise the Lord!!!

I praise Him that is ABLE to do more than we could ever ask or imagine... I am a worship minister here in my hometown. This song has truly blessed me...as I play and sing this...I feel His comforting presence!....Praise the Lord...praise Him! In every circumstance praise Him!
Praise the Lord that He is able to do superabundantly above all that we ask or think!! To Him be the glory forever and ever, Amen!!
kimberly is right this song was made in the summer school of truth in 2010 and this is song will be contiune to be enjoyed forever and ever amen.

Only He is able to accomplish the spiritual things for the church through the resurrection power that operates within our inward being. God is glorified in the church in this age, and God is glorified in Christ Jesus from eternity to eternity. Two powerful verses of scripture made enjoyable in song!

This song is very enjoyable and it contains a great meaning. It was created during Summer School of Truth 2010 and all the young people enjoyed the song. Praise the Lord. He is able to do superabundantly above all that we ask or think!
This song reminds me of Romans 16:25 & 27 we sang in Winter Training 2009. Hallelujah! He is able! Glory to Him! Forever and ever. Amen!
This song came from our enjoyment in the Summer School of Truth last week from August 02-07, 2010 at Langley, BC.
I'm only in my second last year of high school and when we sing this it is very wonderful and enjoyable during the Summer School of Truth.
